business.headline: Trump's tariff list: 14 countries, new rates, and what they export to AmericaUS President Donald Trump confirmed that letters had been sent to several nations, warning them that if new trade agreements are not reached by August 1, increased import duties will be implemented.

Necktie Nomics: Can the RBI Governor's tie colour predict rate moves?An SBI report looked at the ties worn by the RBI Governor during Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meetings. Instead of only watching inflation numbers or GDP data, they turned their attention to the shades of silk draped around the Governor's neck.
Sensex ends flat, Nifty below 25,500; HUL gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 9.61 points higher at 83,442.50, while the NSE Nifty remained flat to end below 25,500.
GCCs push India's office leasing to new heights: ReportGCCs are no longer coming to India just for cheaper costs. They now see India as a strong base for talent, innovation and large modern offices.

Sebi to intensify watch on derivatives trading after Jane Street episodeIndia is currently the world's largest equity derivatives market. According to the Futures Industry Association, it accounted for nearly 60% of the derivatives contracts traded globally in April.

EMIs hurt India's middle class more than inflation, says financial expertToday, almost everything is available on easy monthly instalments, from a new phone to flight tickets, even groceries. What was once a helpful option has now turned into a lifestyle. However, this is silently eating into people's income, leaving little room for savings or emergencies.

Filing ITR for the first time? 7 common errors new taxpayers must avoidFiling your ITR is not enough. You must verify it too. If you forget, the tax department treats it as if you never filed it at all. You can e-verify using Aadhaar OTP, net banking, or by sending a signed physical copy. Without verification, your return stays incomplete.

House rent above Rs 50,000? Here's the TDS rule you need to knowFor tenants living in high-rent homes, the line between a routine payment and a tax lapse can be thinner than it seems, and ignoring it can invite penalties that quickly snowball.

HUL shares gain 2% today. Should you buy the FMCG stock?HUL share price: The stock has gained 3.67% in the last five trading sessions. However, when looking at a longer time frame, the stock is still down 7.97% over the past year.

Lost Rs 18 lakh in 6 months: Financial advisor's warning on online bettingWhat begins as casual fun can spiral into secrecy, debt, and broken trust. A financial advisor warns that, without strong regulation, betting apps are fast becoming one of India's biggest financial threats.

Tariffs on steel, auto unlikely in interim trade deal with US: Government sourcesWith the US to soon notify countries of higher tariffs by July 9, with new rates effective August 1, sectoral levies on steel, auto and aluminium are unlikely in the India-US interim trade deal, government sources said.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 65.28 points to 83,367.61, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 16.45 points to 25,444.55 as of 9:50 am.

entertainment.headline: Boney Kapoor on Anshula's engagement: Your mother's strength lives on in youBoney Kapoor shared an emotional note after his daughter Anshula Kapoor announced her engagement with Rohan Thakkar. In his post on X, the veteran producer blessed the two and expressed his excitement to meet them soon.

Vijay Deverakonda removes 'The' tag after massive trolling: My name is enoughIn 2022, actor Vijay Deverakonda was criticised and trolled for adding 'The' as a tag to his name during the release of 'Liger'. In a recent interview, he opened up about the incident and why he has now decided to drop all tags.

Smriti Irani's Tulsi back with Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, premiere date outThe first promo of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' was unveiled ahead of the show's grand premiere on Star Plus. Smriti Irani will return as Tulsi Virani in the prime-time show.

Denise Richards and Aaron Phypers file for divorce after 6 years of marriageDenise Richards and Aaron Phypers are divorcing after six years of marriage. Phypers filed on July 7, citing irreconcilable differences and seeking spousal support, just months after their Bravo reality show premiered.

Cierra Ortega leaves Love Island USA after racist posts resurface onlineCierra Ortega left Love Island USA ahead of the finale after old posts allegedly containing racial slurs resurfaced. Her family responded to the backlash, calling for accountability without hate.

Priyanka Chopra says doing laundry is tough, got mother-in-law to do it insteadPriyanka Chopra Jonas shared that she finds doing laundry difficult and once cleverly got her mother-in-law to do it for her. The actor shared the funny anecdote while promoting her latest film 'Heads of State'.

Indian BTS fan's hand-drawn sketch captures V's heart in viral momentBTS member V recently made an Indian fan's day in Paris after accepting her sketchbook. He was greeting fans who were gathered outside his hotel.

Jennifer Lopez opens up about split with Ben Affleck in new song: ReportSinger Jennifer Lopez reflects on her split from Ben Affleck in new track 'Wreckage of You'. She released the song during an intimate listening session in Los Angeles.

Jr NTR wraps War 2, calls Hrithik Roshan a powerhouse, teases surpriseJr NTR has completed shooting for the eagerly awaited action thriller 'War 2'. The film, directed by Ayan Mukerji and produced by Yash Raj Films, is set for release on August 14, 2025.

Devdas to Parineeta: Romantic Bollywood films adapted from novelsMany Bollywood love stories have been inspired by famous books and turned into beautiful films. From 'Devdas' to 'Parineeta, these movies show how stories from books can touch hearts on screen too.

BTS' SUGA, Jimin and Jungkook reunite with RM in Los Angeles for album projectFollowing the completion of their military service in June, BTS reunited on July 1 to announce plans for a new album. SUGA, Jimin and Jungkook followed RM to the US to record their upcoming album. Here are the latest updates.

Vijay Sethupathi begins filming for his next with Puri JagannadhVijay Sethupathi has started shooting for his upcoming film directed by Puri Jagannadh in Hyderabad. The project has generated excitement among Tamil cinema fans across India.

You are my enemy: Farah Khan recalls fight with mother for wanting to marry at 23Farah Khan recently shared her personal journey about marriage and motherhood. She recalled how she once wanted to get married at 23 while her mother opposed her decision.

Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom release date out, film to hit cinemas in JulyThe official release date of Vijay Deverakonda's highly-anticipated film, 'Kingdom', is out. The film was facing several release delays.

Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara… faces flak over alleged misrepresentation of folk heroPawan Kalyan's upcoming film 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' has sparked controversy over historical depictions. Concerns about accuracy have been raised by the Bahujan community, prompting discussions on social media.

Saira Banu, Dharmendra pay tribute to Dilip Kumar on his 4th death anniversary. PicsOn Dilip Kumar's fourth death anniversary, Saira Banu and Dharmendra shared emotional tributes remembering the legendary actor. While Saira called him "an entire era," Dharmendra said the loss still feels unbearable.

Smriti Irani announces her return to Kyunki, vows to boost India's creative industrySmriti Irani announced her return as Tulsi Virani in the 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot, highlighting the show's impact on her life and its contribution to Indian television. She released a detailed statement expressing her joy and a promise of creativity.

Who is Sara Arjun, 20-year-old romancing Ranveer Singh in Dhurandhar?20-year-old Sara Arjun has been trending on social media ever since 'Dhurandhar' first look was released on Ranveer Singh's 40th birthday, July 6. Amid debate about the 20-year age-gap between the two, here's all you need to know about actor Sara Arjun.

Exclusive: Kajol says working with mother Tanuja made her shiverKajol revealed she shivered while shooting with her mother Tanuja, describing the experience as surreal. The duo were shooting for the film, Toonpur Ka Superrhero.

general news.headline: Patna businessman's murder accused killed in encounter during arrest attemptAccused in Patna businessman's murder killed in encounter with police during arrest attempt

We are close to making deal with India: Trump after tariff letters to 14 countriesSpeaking during a dinner with Israeli PM Netanyahu, Donald Trump noted that countries unwilling to agree will receive tariff notices. Trump added some may get adjustments if they have valid reasons, stressing fairness in negotiations.

Well-deserved, should get it: Netanyahu nominates Trump for Nobel Peace PrizeNetanyahu praised Trump's pursuit of peace and security, particularly highlighting his leadership in many lands, but now, especially in the Middle East. Trump seemed surprised by the nomination and told Netanyahu, "Coming from you, this means a lot."

Novak Djokovic breaks Roger Federer curse to reach 16th Wimbledon quarterfinalWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic came back from a set down to beat 11th seed Alex de Minaur on Monday. Roger Federer watched the Serb's win from the Royal Box on Center Court.

Texas flash floods kill 104, dozens missing including children at Camp MysticFlash floods in Texas have killed at least 104 people, with dozens still missing. Kerr County was hit hardest, prompting questions over warning systems. President Trump plans to visit the disaster zone.

Hyderabad family of 4 on US vacation dies after vehicle collides with truckThe family was returning from a visit to their relatives in Atlanta when their car was involved in an accident. All four members of the family succumbed to their injuries and died in the car fire.

2 students killed, others injured as train rams into school van in Tamil NaduTwo students died and several were injured after a train hit a school van at a railway crossing in Semmankuppam near Cuddalore.

Incorrect: Asim Munir after India exposes China's hand during Op SindoorPakistan Army chief Asim Munir's remarks came in response to the Indian Army's Deputy Chief Lt Gen Rahul R Singh, who stated that Beijing was active behind the scenes during New Delhi's four-day conflict with Islamabad.

Prada, Crocs, now Birkenstock: Why these shoemakers are in the newsPrada, Crocs and Birkenstock are in the news in India over legal rows and cultural backlash — from counterfeits and copyright battles to criticism over using Kolhapuri chappals designs.

World doesn't want an emperor: Brazil President to Trump over Brics tariff threatLula said that the world needs alternative trade options beyond the dominant currency, in response to Donald Trump's threat to impose extra tariffs on Brics nations. However, the US could act if any of the countries take steps it considers "anti-American."

India abstains from UN resolution on Afghanistan, flags terror concernsIndia's UN envoy, Parvathaneni Harish, says India abstained from a UN resolution on Afghanistan, citing concerns over terror sanctuaries and reiterating support for Afghan people's humanitarian and development needs.

After Japan and Korea, Trump announces steep tariffs on twelve other countriesDonald Trump has announced sweeping new tariffs on imports from South Korea, Japan, and twelve other nations, warning of steeper duties if trading partners retaliate with counter-tariffs.

Jannik Sinner escapes upset as Grigor Dimitrov's injury sends him to quarterfinalsJannik Sinner was given a major reprieve during his fourth-round clash at Wimbledon as Grigor Dimitrov's unfortunate pectoral injury handed him a walkover despite being two sets down in the match.

Woman, 35, forced to drink toilet water, strangled by tantrik during ritual in UPA 35-year-old woman, Anuradha, from Azamgarh, lost her life after a so-called exorcism performed by a local tantrik turned deadly. She was reportedly made to drink filthy water as part of the ritual.

Russian minister sacked by Putin found dead in his car with gunshot woundFormer Russian transport minister Roman Starovoit, 53, was found dead with a gunshot wound near his Tesla in Moscow hours after President Putin dismissed him. Investigators are probing the death, which may be linked to corruption allegations from his time as governor of the Kursk region.

Tahawwur Rana was in Mumbai to oversee 26/11 attack, interrogation revealsDuring questioning by the Mumbai Crime Branch in NIA custody, Tahawwur Rana confirmed his presence in Mumbai during the 26/11 attacks and that it was part of the terrorists' plan, sources told India Today TV.

Watch: Sinner carries injured Dimitrov's bags off court after retirementJannik Sinner showed pure class on Monday at Wimbledon, carrying Grigor Dimitrov's bags off the court after the Bulgarian was forced to retire mid-match due to injury.

Smriti Irani's Tulsi back with Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, premiere date outThe first promo of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' was unveiled ahead of the show's grand premiere on Star Plus. Smriti Irani will return as Tulsi Virani in the prime-time show.

Gujarat man detained at Kerala temple for wearing smartglasses with hidden cameraA Gujarat man was detained at Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple in Thiruvananthapuram in Kerala for wearing camera-equipped smartglasses, violating temple rules.

Free choice: Trump, Netanyahu float relocation plan for PalestiniansSpeaking to reporters at the beginning of a dinner between US and Israeli officials, Netanyahu said the United States and Israel were working with other countries that would give Palestinians a better future.

Anurag Kashyap's daughter Aaliyah re-marries Shane Gregoire, Khushi Kapoor reactsInfluencer Aaliyah Kashyap and Shane Gregoire got married again in a Christian ceremony on Monday. Aaliyah, who is the daughter of director Anurag Kashyap, shared photos from the ceremony on Instagram.

FIR registered against RCB cricketer Yash Dayal in sexual harassment caseAn FIR has been registered against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) fast bowler Yash Dayal for sexually exploiting a woman on the pretext of marriage. According to the complaint, the woman alleged that she was in a five-year relationship with Dayal, during which he mentally, physically, and financially exploited her under the false promise of marriage.

Video: Drunk, semi-naked son of Mumbai politician abuses influencer on cameraA Maharashtra politician's son was filmed verbally abusing a social media influencer who confronted him for ramming into her car. In the video, the politician's son appears half-naked and seems to be under the influence of alcohol.

Indian Muslims hostages, not citizens: Owaisi on Kiren Rijiju's minorities remarkAsaduddin Owaisi and Kiren Rijiju were locked in a high-voltage war of words over Muslim rights and their present situation in India.

Boney Kapoor on Anshula's engagement: Your mother's strength lives on in youBoney Kapoor shared an emotional note after his daughter Anshula Kapoor announced her engagement with Rohan Thakkar. In his post on X, the veteran producer blessed the two and expressed his excitement to meet them soon.

In a recent interview, he opened up about the incident and why he has now decided to drop all tags.

sports.headline: Lord's pitch chatter: Shubman Gill's subtle dig and England's growing headacheEngland vs India, 3rd Test: On a Birmingham featherbed that suits their style, England were outplayed comfortably by Shubman Gill's India. Ahead of the third Test in London, there is speculation that England might resort to a more lively pitch. But, can they afford the extra spice at Lord's?

Watch: Sinner carries injured Dimitrov's bags off court after retirementJannik Sinner showed pure class on Monday at Wimbledon, carrying Grigor Dimitrov's bags off the court after the Bulgarian was forced to retire mid-match due to injury.

Kane Williamson unavailable as New Zealand name squad for Zimbabwe TestsSenior batter Kane Williamson remains unavailable as New Zealand named their squad for the upcoming two-match Test series against Zimbabwe in Bulawayo.

Jannik Sinner escapes upset as Grigor Dimitrov's injury sends him to quarterfinalsJannik Sinner was given a major reprieve during his fourth-round clash at Wimbledon as Grigor Dimitrov's unfortunate pectoral injury handed him a walkover despite being two sets down in the match.

Wimbledon 2025: Ben Shelton defeats Lorenzo Sonego, Mira Andreeva thumps NavarroBen Shelton came out victorious in a hard-fought win over Italy's Lorenzo Sonego in the fourth round, while Mira Andreeva put up a dominant display to join Maria Sharapova as the youngest to progress through to the quarterfinals of Wimbledon.

Gill halfway through to being India's next batting great: Karsan GhavriThe former India cricketer, Karsan Ghavri has gone on to back Shubman Gill, already being on track to be India's next big batting great, following the path of legendary names like Sunil Gavaskar and Sachin Tendulkar. This comes after his sensational performance against England in the Birmingham Test.

Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma attend Wimbledon, watch gladiator Djokovic in actionStar India batter Virat Kohli was in attendance with his Bollywood actor wife Anushka Sharma to watch Novak Djokovic's fourth-round fixture against Alex de Minaur. Djokovic beat his Australian rival 1-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 to progress ahead in the tournament.

Novak Djokovic breaks Roger Federer curse to reach 16th Wimbledon quarterfinalWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic came back from a set down to beat 11th seed Alex de Minaur on Monday. Roger Federer watched the Serb's win from the Royal Box on Center Court.

Nothing should be said about Gambhir: Yograj after India's 2nd Test winYograj Singh believes that Gautam Gambhir has copped a lot of unfair criticism with regards to the Test team, and the head coach should be appreciated instead for giving back to the game that made their careers.

According to the complaint, the woman alleged that she was in a five-year relationship with Dayal, during which he mentally, physically, and financially exploited her under the false promise of marriage.

Brian Lara deserves to keep the record: Wiaan Mulder on declaring before 400South Africa all-rounder Wiaan Mulder revealed the reason behind not going after Brian Lara's record for the highest individual score in Tests and said that he declared on 367 out of respect for the legendary batter.

Gill has taken captaincy, number four role like a duck to water: Mark ButcherENG vs IND: The former England cricketer, Mark Butcher, thinks that Shubman Gill has only gotten better since his appointment as Test captain alongside his batting role at number four during the England tour.

Jofra Archer's ready to go: McCullum on pacer's availability for 3rd TestEngland head coach Brendon McCullum recently revealed that fast bowler Jofra Archer is eager to play in the third Test against India at Lord's, London.

Video: Roger Federer watches Novak Djokovic in action from Wimbledon Royal BoxEight-time champion Roger Federer was accompanied by his wife Mirka to the Royal Box at Center Court. The Swiss great was there to watch Novak Djokovic's fourth-round match against Alex de Minaur on Monday, July 7.

Sai Kishore set to play two games for Surrey in County Championship 2025Tamil Nadu and Gujarat Titans (GT) spinner R Sai Kishore has been signed by Surrey to play in the County Championship 2025. The left-arm spinner has scalped 192 wickets from 46 first class matches.

Why did Wiaan Mulder declare on 367, 33 runs short of Brian Lara's Test record?South Africa vs Zimbabwe, 2nd Test: Wiaan Mulder declared when batting on 367 on Day 2 of the second Test against Zimbabwe in Bulawayo. The stand-in captain had the opportunity to break Brian Lara's all-time record, but chose against it.

We ran second for 5 days: McCullum reflects on crucial toss errorEngland head coach Brendon McCullum admitted that they were left chasing India for the majority of the second Test at Edgbaston in Birmingham after their blunder at the toss.

Prithvi Shaw explains move to Maharashtra after parting ways with MumbaiPrithvi Shaw has moved from Mumbai to Maharashtra for the upcoming domestic season. The out-of-favour India opener hopes the move will rejuvenate his career. Shaw last played for India in 2021.

Wimbledon Day 8 Highlights: Sinner gets a walkover after injury ends Dimitrov's dreamWimbledon 2025 Day 8 Live Updates: Novak Djokovic reaches the quarterfinal of Wimbledon for the 16th time in his career. The Serb defeated Alex de Minaur in four sets.  Earlier in the day, 23-year-old Flavio Cobolli ousted Marin Cilic to reach the quarterfinals of a Grand Slam for the first time in his career.

The Serb defeated Alex de Minaur in four sets.  Earlier in the day, 23-year-old Flavio Cobolli ousted Marin Cilic to reach the quarterfinals of a Grand Slam for the first time in his career.

Wiian Mulder hits 2nd fastest triple hundred in Test cricket historyWiian Mulder became the first ever captain to score a triple hundred in Test cricket. His 297-ball innings is the second fastest, just behind Virender Sehwag's record.

F1: Oscar Piastri brake-checks himself out of victory in British Grand PrixLando Norris claimed a dramatic win at Silverstone after Oscar Piastri brake-checked himself into a second place finish at the British Grand Prix. Nico Hulkenberg secured his first-ever podium in a rain-hit, chaotic race.

Pat Cummins backs Sam Konstas despite inconsistent Test formAustralian captain Pat Cummins has backed young batter Sam Konstas despite his inconsistent Test performances. Cummins highlights the importance of patience and faith in emerging players during challenging phases.

Don't worry about me, do well for India: Akash Deep's sister amid cancer battleIndia pacer Akash Deep delivered a remarkable 10-wicket haul at Edgbaston and dedicated it to his sister battling cancer. In an exclusive interview with Aajtak, Akash Deep's sister reacted to her brother's viral interview and her own cancer treatment.

Shubman Gill 2.0: How Edgbaston Test marked the rise of a potential India greatENG vs IND: Shubman Gill didn't have a great record outside the subcontinent, but the young India captain has put his best foot forward in the ongoing England tour, scoring runs in heaps and guiding India to a 336-run win at Edgbaston.

ICC appoints Sanjog Gupta as Chief Executive OfficerThe International Cricket Council (ICC) has appointed Sanjog Gupta as its new chief executive officer (CEO). He will assume office on July 7, 2025, becoming the seventh CEO in the history of the ICC.

My B-game is enough: Magnus Carlsen after winning Grand Chess Tour ZagrebMagnus Carlsen clinched the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz combined title in Croatia. Carlsen reacted to his win on social media, stating that his B-game was enough to beat the others.

Flat tracks on England tour a missed opportunity for Virat Kohli?Did Virat Kohli time his Test retirement right with flat decks on offer on the ongoing England tour? Kohli's childhood coach, Rajkumar Sharma, opened up on the batter's Test retirement in a conversation with India Today.

Shubman Gill warns declining Dukes ball quality is hurting Test cricket's balanceIndia captain Shubman Gill on Sunday slammed the fast-deteriorating quality of the Dukes ball, while also giving a thumbs down to the trend of flat pitches seen in the first two Tests of the series — despite his own prolific run.

Watch: MS Dhoni celebrates his 44th birthday with friends, cake and warm wishesMS Dhoni rang in his 44th birthday on Monday with a low-key celebration in Ranchi, surrounded by close friends and familiar faces. A clip from the evening - showing the former India captain in a sleeveless T-shirt, cutting cake and sharing laughs - quickly went viral, giving fans a heartwarming glimpse into the cricketer's special day.

Selfish Norris, Piastri slammed for ignoring Hulkenberg on British GP podiumNico Hulkenberg secured his first ever Formula 1 podium at the British Grand Prix. At the celebrations, he was ignored by both McLaren drivers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
